gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.Menu
Class ViewMenuItem

java.lang.Object
  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.Menu.ViewMenuItem

public class ViewMenuItem
extends java.lang.Object

ViewMenuItem wraps a JMenuItem with its "path". The path specifies where on the menu bar the JMenuItem should be placed.

Field Summary

          "Edit" - constant String to specify the placement into the Edit menu.

Constructor Detail

ViewMenuItem

public ViewMenuItem(javax.swing.JMenuItem mitem)
Constructor takes in a menu item and initializes path to an empty string. This can be used when a view component has a menu item, but doesn't care where it is placed.

Parameters:
mitem - - JMenuItem

ViewMenuItem

public ViewMenuItem(java.lang.String path,
                    javax.swing.JMenuItem mitem)
Constructor can be used when a view component wants to recommend the placement of a menu item.

Parameters:
path -
mitem - - JMenuItem
Method Detail

setPath

public void setPath(java.lang.String path)
Set the "path" of the JMenuItem after verifying initial menu exists. Note: The format for path is . Both are optional, but a submenu cannot exist without a menu. The actual item name will be added to the path implicitly, so it shouldn't be included in the path.

Parameters:
path -

getPath

public java.lang.String getPath()
Full list of menu/submenus under which this item will be placed. Note: The format for path is .. If does not exist, path is an empty string

Returns:
path

getItem

public javax.swing.JMenuItem getItem()
Gives access to the menu item being added to the menu bar.

Returns:
item
